meanings.definition: Arrange (a number of things) in a pile.
meanings.sent1: I am stacking my books neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys stacking blocks to build tall towers.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was stacking acorns like a tiny architect.
meanings.sent4: His achievements were stacking up like a tower of blocks.
meanings.sent5: The children were stacking colorful cups in a fun game.

meanings.definition: Place (objects) on top of each other.
meanings.sent1: Please start stacking the chairs against the wall.
meanings.sent2: The workers were stacking boxes in the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The cat was stacking toys in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were stacking in the sky like fluffy pillows.
meanings.sent5: He was stacking logs to build a cozy fire.

meanings.sent1: She placed the books in a neat stacking on the table.
meanings.sent2: The toys were in a colorful stacking in the corner.
meanings.sent3: The stacking of pillows on the bed looked inviting.
meanings.sent4: The stacking of plates in the cupboard was organized.
meanings.sent5: The stacking of papers on the desk needed sorting.
